abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Hebei Urban Environment
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: (i) policy dialogue with the Hebei Government on
            tariff reforms and improvement of operational efficiency at
            early stage of project preparation. This was intended to
            encourage incentives for resource conservation and to create
            a more reliable income stream; (ii) as an integral part of
            the project design substantial tariff adjustments were
            implemented during the preparation stage and prior to
            negotiation. In addition to that Bank and municipal
            governments agreed upfront on a schedule for tariff
            adjustments during the implementation of the project; and
            (iii) Industrial Pollution Control Action Plan (IPCAP) for
            each city outlining preliminary actions to reduce the scale
            of pollution loads from industrial sectors and in turn
            maximize expected environmental benefits from municipal investments.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Hebei Urban Environment Project aims
            to provide a safe environment and to sustain the long-term
            economic growth of urban areas in Hebei Province. It will
            support Heibei Province in implementing a long-term urban
            environmental services improvement program to recover from
            environmental degradation of its water and land resources,
            provide an adequate supply of safe water, and ensure
            sustainability of delivery through institutional and
            financial reforms of the service utilities. The project
            comprises seven components: 1) Shijiazhuang wastewater and
            2) Tangshan wastewater will support the construction of
            sewer interceptors, a conventional activated sludge sewerage
            treatment plant and a secondary sewer program. 3) Tangshan
            water supply will finance the works of a raw water intake
            pumping station, a water treatment plant, and a raw water
            transmission main. 4) Handan water supply will finance raw
            water intake works, construction of a gravity raw water
            transmission main, and strengthening of distribution
            networks. 5) Handan wastewater will support the construction
            of sewer interceptors, rehabilitation and expansion of the
            North Sewage Pumping Station. 6) The sixth component will
            cover institutional development, financial strengthening,
            operation enhancement, and management and geographic
            information. 7) The last component will support an action
            plan for industrial pollution control.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Hebei Urban Environmental Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Hebei Urban Environmental Project , which develops
            wastewater treatment projects in several cities discusses
            expected adverse environmental impacts. They will be
            mitigated as follows: Construction activities will adopt low
            noise machinery and night work will be prohibited near
            residential areas. Sludge will be disposed of at municipal
            sanitary landfills, if not used as composite fertilizer, and
            the residue treated with lime before being disposed of.
            Discarded earth and construction waste will be transported
            to dump sites (sink pits). Sprinkle water on dust and cover
            transporting vehicles. To relieve traffic congestion,
            temporary roads will be paved at heavy traffic sections and
            materials transported during non-rush hours. A buffer
            greenbelt will be built to reduce odors from emissions, and
            trees replanted after construction, particularly along
            roadsides after road restoration. Use discarded earth and
            construction waste as backfill earth. Level excavated land,
            cover it with cultivated soil, and restore vegetation.
            Discharge wastewater into the sewage system. To prevent
            chlorine leakage in the pumping station, operational
            management will be strengthened. Box-net fishing which
            causes eutrophication will be banned. Strengthen soil
            conservation to prevent pollution from farmland and village
            runoff by more efficiently using chemical fertilizers and
            pesticides, and tightening control of animal excrement, and
            garbage collection.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Hebei Urban Environment Project -
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Hebei Urban Environment Project will
            establish wastewater treatment plants in Shijiazhuang,
            Tangshan, and Handan Cities. This resettlement action plan
            describes the policy and standards of relocation and
            compensation. Policies on house demolition, relocation, and
            compensation of the project are as follows: The compensation
            standards of all property affected should be fixed in
            accordance with replacement principles. The compensation
            should be paid before the requisition of land and property.
            Project Offices should negotiate with the owners of affected
            property about the standards of relocation and compensation
            and resettlement methods. The shops that will be affected by
            the project and stop doing business due to such construction
            shall get compensation for loss from suspense of business in
            accordance with average profit of each shop, the wage of the
            employees, and the actual cessation period. More attention
            will be paid to shorten the construction period and reduce
            the loss from the suspense of business. The affected public
            infrastructure should be restored and reconstructed. The
            land compensation and resettlement subsidy for the
            requisitioned land should be calculated and paid in
            accordance with Land Administration Law. Agricultural
            laborers will be offered relocation assistance, training,
            and employment opportunities. Full compensation for crops
            and other attached facilities should be calculated based on
            market prices. Illegal buildings will be compensated.
